intro: Biscutella laevigata var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or chaparral habitats. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
